service: The Amazon Chime SDK Identity APIs in this section allow software developers to create and manage unique instances of their messaging applications. These APIs provide the overarching framework for creating and sending messages. For more information about the identity APIs, refer to .

operations.CreateAppInstance:
Creates an Amazon Chime SDK messaging AppInstance under an AWS account. Only SDK messaging customers use this API. CreateAppInstance supports idempotency behavior as described in the AWS API Standard.

identity
operations.CreateAppInstanceAdmin:
Promotes an AppInstanceUser to an AppInstanceAdmin. The promoted user can perform the following actions.

  • ChannelModerator actions across all channels in the AppInstance.

  • DeleteChannelMessage actions.

Only an AppInstanceUser can be promoted to an AppInstanceAdmin role.
operations.CreateAppInstanceUser: Creates a user under an Amazon Chime AppInstance. The request consists of a unique appInstanceUserId and Name for that user.
operations.DeleteAppInstance: Deletes an AppInstance and all associated data asynchronously.
operations.DeleteAppInstanceAdmin: Demotes an AppInstanceAdmin to an AppInstanceUser. This action does not delete the user.
operations.ListAppInstanceAdmins: Returns a list of the administrators in the AppInstance.
operations.ListAppInstances: Lists all Amazon Chime AppInstances created under a single AWS account.
operations.PutAppInstanceRetentionSettings: Sets the amount of time in days that a given AppInstance retains data.
operations.UpdateAppInstanceUser: Updates the details of an AppInstanceUser. You can update names and metadata.

AppInstance.base: The details of an AppInstance, an instance of an Amazon Chime SDK messaging application.

refs.DescribeAppInstanceResponse$AppInstance: The ARN, metadata, created and last-updated timestamps, and the name of the AppInstance. All timestamps use epoch milliseconds.

refs.DescribeAppInstanceAdminResponse$AppInst: The ARN and name of the AppInstanceUser, the ARN of the AppInstance, and the created and last-updated timestamps. All timestamps use epoch milliseconds.

AppInstanceRetentionSettings.base: The details of the data-retention settings for an AppInstance.

refs.PutAppInstanceRetentionSettingsRequest$A: The time in days to retain data. Data type: number.
refs.PutAppInstanceRetentionSettingsResponse$: The time in days to retain data. Data type: number.

BadRequestException.base: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

ChannelRetentionSettings.base: The details of the retention settings for a channel.

refs.AppInstanceRetentionSettings$ChannelRete: The length of time in days to retain the messages in a channel.

refs.AppInstanceAdmin$AppInstanceArn: The ARN of the AppInstance for which the user is an administrator.
refs.CreateAppInstanceAdminRequest$AppInstanc: The ARN of the administrator of the current AppInstance.
refs.CreateAppInstanceAdminResponse$AppInstan: The ARN of the of the admin for the AppInstance.
refs.DeleteAppInstanceUserRequest$AppInstance: The ARN of the user request being deleted.

refs.CreateAppInstanceUserRequest$ClientReque: The token assigned to the user requesting an AppInstance.

ConflictException.base: The request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource.

ForbiddenException.base: The client is permanently forbidden from making the request.

refs.CreateAppInstanceAdminResponse$AppInstan: The name and ARN of the admin for the AppInstance.

refs.ListAppInstanceAdminsRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of administrators that you want to return.
refs.ListAppInstanceUsersRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of requests that you want returned.
refs.ListAppInstancesRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of AppInstances that you want to return.

refs.CreateAppInstanceRequest$Metadata: The metadata of the AppInstance. Limited to a 1KB string in UTF-8.
refs.CreateAppInstanceUserRequest$Metadata: The request's metadata. Limited to a 1KB string in UTF-8.
refs.UpdateAppInstanceRequest$Metadata: The metadata that you want to change.

refs.ListAppInstanceAdminsRequest$NextToken: The token returned from previous API requests until the number of administrators is reached.
refs.ListAppInstanceAdminsResponse$NextToken: The token returned from previous API requests until the number of administrators is reached.
refs.ListAppInstanceUsersRequest$NextToken: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.
refs.ListAppInstanceUsersResponse$NextToken: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.
refs.ListAppInstancesRequest$NextToken: The token passed by previous API requests until you reach the maximum number of AppInstances.
refs.ListAppInstancesResponse$NextToken: The token passed by previous API requests until the maximum number of AppInstances is reached.

refs.UpdateAppInstanceRequest$Name: The name that you want to change.

refs.ChannelRetentionSettings$RetentionDays: The time in days to retain the messages in a channel.

Tag.base: Describes a tag applied to a resource.

ThrottledClientException.base: The client exceeded its request rate limit.

refs.AppInstance$CreatedTimestamp: The time at which an AppInstance was created. In epoch milliseconds.
refs.AppInstance$LastUpdatedTimestamp: The time an AppInstance was last updated. In epoch milliseconds.
refs.AppInstanceAdmin$CreatedTimestamp: The time at which an administrator was created.
refs.AppInstanceUser$CreatedTimestamp: The time at which the AppInstanceUser was created.
refs.AppInstanceUser$LastUpdatedTimestamp: The time at which the AppInstanceUser was last updated.
refs.GetAppInstanceRetentionSettingsResponse$: The timestamp representing the time at which the specified items are retained, in Epoch Seconds.
refs.PutAppInstanceRetentionSettingsResponse$: The time at which the API deletes data.

UnauthorizedClientException.base: The client is not currently authorized to make the request.
